posts.content:
Hi Rick,

have you seen the Firetec bulk buy deal thread that's running at the moment. Jim's got a cracking deal so far (14% discount) and if he gets 3 more people buying we'll all get a bit more.

Steve

rusty1962 wrote:Hi Rick,

have you seen the Firetec bulk buy deal thread that's running at the moment. Jim's got a cracking deal so far (14% discount) and if he gets 3 more people buying we'll all get a bit more.

Steve


I've seen the thread, but not looked at it. Im not sure if I wanted one or not, I'll have a look

Cheers

Rick T wrote:

have you seen the Firetec bulk buy deal thread that's running at the moment. Jim's got a cracking deal so far (14% discount) and if he gets 3 more people buying we'll all get a bit more.

Steve


I've seen the thread, but not looked at it. Im not sure if I wanted one or not, I'll have a look

Cheers


I was initially like that, but then started to hear the stories about engines catching fire so I have decided to err on the side of caution.

You got any more done yet? I've had no time for a couple of days

Steve

I have one fitted in Peebles with pics showing location before engine is fitted.
I have fuel cut off valve as well but key controlled at the front.
I joined the group buy to get one got Sherry...From Upper Sheringham. ..
LOL

rusty1962 wrote:
Rick T wrote:
rusty1962 wrote:Hi Rick,

have you seen the Firetec bulk buy deal thread that's running at the moment. Jim's got a cracking deal so far (14% discount) and if he gets 3 more people buying we'll all get a bit more.

Steve


I've seen the thread, but not looked at it. Im not sure if I wanted one or not, I'll have a look

Cheers


I was initially like that, but then started to hear the stories about engines catching fire so I have decided to err on the side of caution.

You got any more done yet? I've had no time for a couple of days

Steve


I keep having a hour or two, but to be honest it's all boring stuff so I never take any pictures. Welded up the holes in the dash and did quite a bit on the b posts where someone had fitted seat belts and drilled about a million holes(no photos though)
I've got two more repairs to do, about a hour n half each I reckon and loads of grinding. I'm tempted to do a bit of filler, but that's probably to cover my dodgy welding before I drop it off!!! I'm not going to though I'm sure they can sort it. I've got a price for the paint job, but can see it going up as every single panel needs attention. It didn't look that bad when they came out! Not really bothered though as I'm that far into this now I just want to get it done.

Just realised, I've had my bus a year!!,,

Said I wanted it at paint shop for Christmas, only 3 month late.

Rick T wrote:Just realised, I've had my bus a year!!,,

Said I wanted it at paint shop for Christmas, only 3 month late.


â€¦or 9 months early

Little job I almost forgot to do!!

Need to stop taking pics with my phone, there never the right way up
32 degrees round pool today in Tenerife!!! defo not missing working on the bus in freezing temperatures

Rick T wrote:32 degrees round pool today in Tenerife!!! defo not missing working on the bus in freezing temperatures


A good point, well made

I bet you'll be all enthusiastic when you get back though 'cos even though you're there, you're still thinking about the SSVC and your bus

( I know 'cos I did the same a few weeks back)

Enjoy your hols

Steve
Thought I'd have a hour rebuilding the the front beam today, over a year since I dismantled it so had to revert to some old photos I took, will finish tomorrow but seem to have lost one of bolts

Next job, sort the bumpers. Bus didn't come with much, but did have the OG deluxe slash cut bumpers. No rust either, so going to weld a couple of holes up from the tow bar and reversing lights then off to get sandblasted

Also pulled out the wiring loom for a look, it came inside the bus from the states but don't know who made it as no name on the bag or instructions. Says complete wiring harness minus dome lights, read the instructions and haven't got a clue!
Looks like a wire works loom I fitted on my bus, was a good loom, does it say on the paperwork who made it
